definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

sentences.english: There was no longer any question of discovering a posteriori laws of social change.
sentences.chinese: 之後便不再有有關社會變革的法則出現。

sentences.english: The stakes are higher, people are restless, poised for even greater transformation.
sentences.chinese: 人們正馬不停蹄地準備迎接更大的變革。

sentences.english: Revenue and Margin Driver Suppliers take actions that go much further than improving supply chain efficiencies, reactively or proactively.
sentences.chinese: 收入和邊際利潤驅動廠商對供應鏈的變革更進一步。

sentences.english: BRM---Business Risk Management. It is to evaluate the business risk involved for any change in the process.
sentences.chinese: 針對流程的任何變革可能給業務帶來的風險進行管理。

sentences.english: And as we all know, change is often slow and incremental.
sentences.chinese: 正如我們所知，變革往往是緩慢和漸進的。

sentences.english: Would this change affect existing student visa holders?
sentences.chinese: 鐒這項變革對現行的學生簽證持有者有影響嗎？

sentences.english: Media industrialization is a omni-directional change.
sentences.chinese: 媒體產業化是一次全方位的變革。

sentences.english: Forest Eco-economic Productivity and the Development of Forestry Produce;
sentences.chinese: 生產力的發展是社會變革的根本動力。

sentences.english: At present, the theory of the Chinese subject have the newchanges.
sentences.chinese: 目前，語文學科教學理念有了新的變革。

sentences.english: I mean, in this last month, things have changed.
sentences.chinese: 因爲上個月變革開始了。

sentences.english: They are prepared for long-term social change.
sentences.chinese: 他們做好了長期社會變革的準備。

sentences.english: In plainer words, the company must change its ways radically.
sentences.chinese: 簡單的說，公司必須進行巨大變革。

sentences.english: But there are big risks, too, in aggressively pushing change.
sentences.chinese: 當然如果冒進推動這種變革，同時存在很大風險。

sentences.english: These advancements in technology purvey benefits and impel organizations to change.
sentences.chinese: 這些科技的進步提供了好處，從而促使組織的變革。

sentences.english: We are not yet at such a crossroads.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在站在商業變革之路上前所未有的十字路口處。

sentences.english: And now they want to revolutionize email.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們想變革電子郵件。

definition: innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to drive/to propel/drive (vehicle wheel)/drive mechanism (tape or disk)/device driver (computing software)
